column2: Position: Facility Executive (Technical) Role Summary:  The Facility Executive (Technical) is responsible for overseeing and managing all technical aspects of a facility or building. To ensure that the facility operates efficiently and effectively, meeting the needs of its occupants and supporting the company's operations. The Facility Executive (Technical) must possess strong technical knowledge and experience in various engineering disciplines. Responsibilities: Technical Management : Oversee the technical operations of the facility, including maintenance, repairs, renovations, and equipment installation. Ensure compliance with all applicable codes, regulations, and standards. Maintenance Planning:  Develop and implement a comprehensive maintenance plan, including preventive maintenance schedules, to ensure optimal functioning of all systems and equipment within the facility. Vendor Management:  Source, contract, and supervise vendors, contractors, and service providers for facility maintenance, repairs, and upgrades. Ensure service level agreements are met, and work is completed on time and within budget. Energy Management:  Implement energy conservation initiatives and monitor energy usage to maximize efficiency and reduce costs. Identify opportunities for energy savings through equipment optimization and system upgrades. Emergency Management:  Develop and maintain emergency response plans, including fire safety protocols, evacuation procedures, and disaster recovery strategies. Coordinate with appropriate authorities and stakeholders during emergency situations. Technical Projects: Lead facility construction or renovation projects, from initial concept planning to final execution. Collaborate with architects, engineers, and contractors to ensure successful project delivery. Occupant Support: Respond to occupant requests, inquiries, and complaints related to the technical aspects of the facility. Assess needs and provide technical guidance or solutions as necessary. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Facility Management, or a related field. Proven experience in facility management and technical operations within commercial buildings or similar facilities. Strong technical knowledge in mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systems. Familiarity with building codes, regulations, and safety standards. Project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to liaise with internal stakeholders, vendors, and contractors. Proficiency in computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) and facility management software is preferred. Knowledge of energy management and sustainability practices is a plus.
column11: Technical Operations, Facility Operations, Maintenance Management, Facility Services
